column4: hey guys im about to install Ubuntu, ive got a 30gig hardrive, and about 14gigs is used by windows, id like to keep windows though, im using gnome partition, but i dont really understand it
if you have free space (unallocated, or not formated space) you can choose "use largest contingues space" in the installation, it will not remove your windows partition
you can use norton partition magic to resize your ntfs partition to make room for ubuntu, but it is not a free software
i would recomend more unless you plan on installing just ubuntu server
